title: 109_hr5413
content: The Act aims to improve the codification of title 46, United States Code, by incorporating public comments and amendments made after the cutoff date specified in the bill. It specifically addresses personal injury or death of seamen. Section 30104 of title 46, United States Code is amended to allow seamen injured in the course of employment to bring an action under US laws for personal injury or death, with the option of maintaining the action in admiralty or as an action at law with trial by jury. Venue for actions at law will be in the judicial district where the employer resides. The amended Section 30104 of title 46, United States Code allows injured seamen to bring a personal injury or death action under US laws, with the option of maintaining it in admiralty or as an action at law with trial by jury. Venue for actions at law will be in the judicial district where the employer resides or where the employer's principal office is located. Amendments to Chapter 537 include changes to Section 30104 of title 46, United States Code allowing injured seamen to bring personal injury or death actions under US laws, with the option of maintaining it in admiralty or as an action at law with trial by jury. Amendments to title 46, United States Code include redesignating paragraphs, defining terms like Administrator and Secretary, and updating priorities for certain vessels. The term 'Secretary' refers to the Secretary of Commerce for fishing vessels and fishery facilities. In guaranteeing obligations under this chapter, priority is given to vessels constructed with assistance under the Maritime Security Act of 2003. Priority for guarantee under this chapter is given to vessels constructed with assistance under the Maritime Security Act of 2003, and vessels suitable for naval auxiliary service in times of war or national emergency that address sealift capacity shortfalls. The Secretary of Defense will determine if a vessel is suitable for naval auxiliary service in times of war or national emergency and meets sealift capacity needs within 30 days of a request from the Administrator. Section 53707 of title 46, United States Code, is amended to include the Administrator in certain subsections. Section 53707 of title 46, United States Code is amended to include the Administrator in certain subsections, allowing for their involvement in determining vessel suitability for naval auxiliary service. Section 53708 of title 46, United States Code is amended to replace references to the Secretary with the Administrator in various subsections. Section 53708 of title 46, United States Code is amended to replace references to the Secretary with the Administrator in various subsections, including changes to financial structures and risk factors analysis. The subsections of Section 53708 of title 46, United States Code are amended to replace references to the Secretary with the Administrator for conducting independent analysis on financial structures and risk factors. Section 53712(b) of title 46, United States Code is amended to include requirements for additional risk factors identified by the Secretary or Administrator if a requirement under section 53707(d) has been waived. Section 53712(b) of title 46, United States Code is amended to include requirements for additional payments, collateral, or equity contributions if a requirement under section 53707(d) has been waived. Subsections (c) and (d) of section 53717 are also amended to remove references to "of Commerce." Additionally, section 53732(e)(2) is amended. (6) Subsections (c) and (d) of section 53717 of title 46, United States Code, are amended to remove references to "of Commerce." Section 53732(e)(2) is also amended by inserting "of Defense" after "Secretary." Various provisions of title 46 are amended to replace "Secretary" and "Secretary of Transportation" with "Administrator." Section 53710(b)(2)(A)(i), 53717(b), 53718, 53731, 53732, and 53733 are amended to replace "Secretary" with "Administrator". Section 53710(b)(1) is also amended to replace "Secretary's" with "Administrator's" in title 46, United States Code. Section 53710(b)(1) of title 46, United States Code, is amended by replacing "Secretary's" with "Administrator's". Various provisions in title 46 are amended to insert "or Administrator" after "Secretary" where applicable. Sections 53722 and 53723 in chapter 537 are amended, along with various other sections in title 46, United States Code. Amendments include inserting "or Administrator's" after "Secretary's" in specific sections. SEC. 4. MISCELLANEOUS AMENDMENTS. Title 46, United States Code, is amended by changing "Naval Reserve" to "Navy Reserve" in chapters 513 and 515. Section 51504(f) is amended to specify that the Secretary will cover fuel costs for State maritime academies for vessel training, with set maximum amounts. The amendment covers fuel costs for vessel training at State maritime academies, with maximum payment amounts set at $100,000 for fiscal year 2006, $200,000 for fiscal year 2007, and $300,000 for fiscal year 2008 onwards. Additionally, Section 51505(b)(2)(B) is updated to increase the payment limits to $300,000 for fiscal year 2006, $400,000 for fiscal year 2007, and $500,000 for fiscal year 2008 onwards. Section 51505(b)(2)(B) is amended to increase payment limits to $300,000 for fiscal year 2006, $400,000 for fiscal year 2007, and $500,000 for fiscal year 2008 onwards. Section 51701(a) is amended to include functions to assist the United States merchant marine as determined necessary by the Secretary. Section 51907 is amended to allow the Secretary of Transportation to provide decorations, medals, and replacements. The Secretary of Transportation may provide decorations, medals, and replacements for the United States merchant marine as authorized by this chapter. The Secretary of Transportation may provide decorations, medals, and replacements for the United States merchant marine under the new chapter 541. The Secretary of Transportation may provide assistance for small shipyards and maritime communities under section 54101 of title 46, United States Code. Section 54101 of title 46, United States Code is amended by inserting "or" after paragraph (2), striking paragraph (3), and redesignating paragraph (4) as paragraph (3). Section 60301 is amended to increase the tonnage fee to 4.5 cents per ton for fiscal years 2006 through 2010, and 2 cents per ton thereafter. The tonnage fee is amended to 4.5 cents per ton for fiscal years 2006 through 2010, and 2 cents per ton thereafter. The tonnage fee is amended to 13.5 cents per ton for fiscal years 2006 through 2010, and 6 cents per ton for each fiscal year thereafter, not to exceed a total of 67.5 cents per ton per year. SEC. 5. REPEALS. The following provisions are repealed, except for rights, duties, penalties, or proceedings before the enactment of this Act. In 1936, Public Law 858, Section 1113 was enacted, related to U.S. Code (46 App.) 1279f. In 1936, Public Law 858, Section 1113 was enacted, related to U.S. Code (46 App.) 1279f. In 2006, Jan. 6, sections 109-163 and 515(g)(2) were added, along with sections 119 and 3236, related to U.S. Code 1131, 1295b, and 1295c. Additionally, section 3502 was included, along with section 119 and 3547, related to U.S. Code 1295c. On Feb. 8, sections 109-171 and 4001 were added, related to U.S. Code 27, 121, and 132. The Act will only be effective if H.R. 1442 in the 109th Congress is enacted, becoming effective immediately after its enactment.
